[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Qheadache defines requirements for developers and testers to implement game features and UI.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: Qheadache is a standalone puzzle game designed to provide an interactive interface for solving user-defined challenges.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: Qheadache integrates with mouse, keyboard, and display systems for user interaction.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: Qheadache supports graphical menus, real-time visual feedback, and sound effects.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: Requires a keyboard, mouse, and a display with a minimum resolution of 800x600.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: Built using the Qt graphical library, ensuring compatibility with all Qt-supported platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: Handles user input and output via mouse, keyboard, and graphical display.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The system optimizes memory usage to support seamless gameplay.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: Qheadache supports single-player mode with game state management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: Compatible with all systems that meet hardware and software specifications.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: Qheadache provides undo/redo functionality, time tracking, and score management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Intended for users aged 8 and above with basic computer skills.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires compatible hardware and a Qt-supported OS.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Requires functional Qt graphical libraries and compatible hardware.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall support mouse and keyboard for gameplay interactions.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall require a graphical display with a minimum resolution of 800x600.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall support undo/redo functionality for up to roughly a thousand actions (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track and display user actions and elapsed time during gameplay.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall record and display scores, associating them with user profiles (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive menu system with graphical elements.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The game shall provide real-time visual feedback for user actions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update user statistics instantly of an action and provide a lag-free experience.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store undo/redo history for up to roughly a thousand actions.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall securely store player scores and performance statistics.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular architecture for easier updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with Qt-supported operating system guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with cross-platform graphical standards supported by Qt.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet accessibility standards to accommodate users with visual impairments.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall be portable across Windows and other Qt-supported platforms.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log errors for debugging and troubleshooting.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Testing validates undo/redo, performance, and UI.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Setup guides, user manuals, and game optimization practices.
[SEC] 5. References: Qt documentation and UI design standards.
